Description:
Enviable Location Many Options
Exceptional opportunity to purchase a modern masterpiece in a prestigious location. A prominent and enviable position, Steane Street is close to many notable amenities including the CBD, Kennington Reservoir, quality schools, major supermarkets and specialty stores.
An expert eye has overseen the design and construction of this stunning townhouse. Luxurious natural tones are echoed throughout the home - polished timber flooring, stone, and hardwood timber are strikingly contrasted against top of the range carpets and tiles.
A flexible and contemporary floorplan, the home boasts four bedrooms, three bathrooms, two living spaces and three separate decks. Raise your glass and toast to one of many perfect evenings to be enjoyed entertaining at home - you will feel on top of the world.
The sleek kitchen features top of the range appliances including a 900mm freestanding gas oven, stone benchtops with an under mount sink, and is open to the main living area. Gorgeous floorboards and floor to ceiling windows make the room come alive as the sunlight streams in.
With a shower that needs to be seen to be believed, the master ensuite is a show stopper. Catering for a king-sized bed the main bedroom also has a brilliantly appointed walk-in robe and a private third level deck to allow you to take in the Bendigo skyline views.
Entertain friends, or enjoy a quiet night soaking away your worries in the built-in waterfall outdoor spa. Natural gas connections will allow you to hook up your bbq and heater, and there are wired in speakers to help create a real party atmosphere.
The fully self-contained lower level can be completely separate and secured off from the rest of the home should you wish. With its own security gate, off-street entrance and private lawned courtyard the area boasts two full sized bedrooms with BIRs, a living space, kitchenette and generous bathroom with laundry facilities. This is a great option to obtain extra income and lease out to tenants, or open up to the remainder of the house and use as a teenage retreat, or professional consult rooms for meetings and appointments etc.
Further attributes include zoned heating and cooling on all levels, surround sound, security surveillance and tinted windows for thermal control and extra privacy. Manicured landscaping completes this property on 330m². All the boxes are ticked, a rare find with nothing left to do but simply enjoy the pleasures of luxury living.

Description:
THE ADDRESS SAYS IT ALL!
The Strand has to be one of Kennington's best kept secrets. Tucked in between Yallambee Drive and Mafeking Street, it is a whisper-quiet, private little street handy to all facilities.
Standing tall at number 17, this quality-built, two-storey home has been meticulously loved and cared for by the same family for decades, and it shows.
Full of original features, it offers a generous floor plan with four bedrooms plus study, two bathrooms and two extra large living spaces.
Ground floor accommodation includes a study and formal lounge/dining rooms flanking the tiled, light-filled entry foyer. The large lounge features brick feature wall and gas heating with both lounge and dining rooms enjoying sliding door access to a North-facing alfresco courtyard.
The kitchen boasts solid Blackwood cabinetry with electric cooktop, double oven, dishwasher and walk-in pantry while the family room features built-in wall unit, gas heating and air conditioning. In-house vaccuum is a valuable addition to the property. A rear vestibule/mud room and large laundry include good storage with bench space for a sewing/hobby nook while a rear verandah offers a quiet place to sit and enjoy the serene environs.
A beautiful Merbau timber staircase rises to the upper level sleeping quarters with four bedrooms, (BIR) and family bathroom with separate shower room, WC and vanity. The main suite includes walk-through robes to full ensuite.
Outside, the auto double garage has direct access to the family room and the private, terraced back garden includes bluestone retaining walls and a unique back fence made of recycled granite bricks salvaged from the old tramways.
Located on approx 747m² allotment in one of Bendigo's prestigious pockets, it's close enough to walk to Coles supermarket, pharmacy, doctor and public transport with Strath Village, LaTrobe University and the CBD a 5-minute drive away.
With a classical past and a promising future, the 1980 property has escaped restyling and offers purchasers the chance to keep the untainted retro features or undertake a total makeover.

Description:
MODERN EASY CARE HOME IN PERFECT LOCATION
Perfectly positioned in one of Kenningtons popular tightly held streets, is this easy care, contemporary home. Just a few blocks from the supermarkets and cafes at Strath Village, and the picturesque Kennington Reservoir, this beautifully finished Simmonds-built home is surprisingly spacious and offers a fantastic, flexible design.
The neatly landscaped front garden provides ample off-street parking. In addition to a long drive leading to the single garage, an additional driveway is perfect for extra vehicles, or a caravan or boat. Steps lead up to a covered portico and the main entrance opens into a neat little living space alongside a study nook. To one side of the entrance is a hallway that creates a parents retreat, with a large walk-in robe and light and bright ensuite, before reaching the spacious master bedroom that includes dual aspect windows.
To the other end of the home are two further bedrooms, both with built-in robes. A family bathroom, separate toilet and great laundry with ample storage can also be accessed off the central hallway. At the rear of the house is an open plan kitchen, dining and living room. The beautifully designed galley kitchen offers ample storage, including a walk-in pantry, and a gas log fire in the lounge provides extra comfort during the cooler months.
Large sliding doors from the living space open out to a fantastic entertaining space. This alfresco area includes a ceiling fan, TV point, built-in barbeque with a sink and cupboards, bar seating, power and lighting perfectly fitted out to serve as a third living space. Step down to a lovely surprise with even more living space. An outdoor studio currently serving as a rumpus room makes for a flexible extra living area. A teen retreat, art studio, home office or additional lounge can be enjoyed from this great space with large sliding doors and floor-to-ceiling windows. The yard is completed by a gravel courtyard, the perfect place to sit and relax in the sunshine.
Additional features include:
Ducted refrigerative cooling and heating and split systems throughout
Ceiling fans in all bedrooms
Secure access from the garage into to the home
Great storage options
Modern kitchen appliances including five-burner gas cooktop, 900mm oven and dishwasher
Secure access from the side of the property to the rear yard
Just three years old and immaculately presented, this fantastic property would be absolutely ideal for a retiree looking to downsize to an easier lifestyle, whilst still maintaining all the benefits and space of a family home. Close to all amenities and with a high-end finish, this property is ready to move into and enjoy life.

Description:
A SUPERB PERIOD HOME IN PRIVATE GARDEN SETTING OF 1775M2
Beyond the private, secluded driveway awaits this magnificent period home which has been loved, meticulously renovated and extended over the past thirty-three years to what is now a magnificent character filled property on approximately 1,775m2 in one of Kennington's most sought-after locations. Positioned within walking distance to Primary and Secondary Colleges, Supermarket and Post Office and an easy 15 minute walk to the CBD.
The home boasts over 26 squares of quality living on two levels with polished Baltic Pine and Tassie Oak floors, high ceilings, ornate fire places, double-hung timber windows, elaborate light fittings and some leadlight all adding to its charm. There's central gas heating and evaporative cooling throughout for comfort.
Up-stairs are three bedrooms with built in robes (each with Noirot heaters), a foyer or study and a bathroom - the ideal kids retreat. The spacious main bedroom is on ground level and includes a brand-new quality en-suite and walk-through robe. Adjacent is the fifth bedroom which is currently used as a library which features a large built-in bookshelf, customised filing drawers and an open fire place.
Living space is abundant with a large formal carpeted lounge boasting high ceilings and big sash-windows, feature wood heater and unique antique pendant lighting. The formal dining room (or multi-purpose) is adjacent with access outside. The kitchen is modern with a country twist and includes Jarrah bench-tops and a leadlight feature window, good storage and European appliances. The living hub includes a spacious meals area and open-plan family room which features a beautiful bay window overlooking the rear garden and French Doors accessing the large paved outdoor space. The third bathroom (with sunken spa), laundry and foyer/study nook are all handy to the living hub.
The yard is very private and boasts numerous beautiful established trees including Silver Birch, Cape Chestnut, Indian Bean, Manchurian Pears and various fruit trees. The yard is flat and square offering space for a pool, large shed and tennis court STCA. There is a double carport, 4m x 6m approx. workshop; two water tanks and 12 solar panels and much more.
This is a one-off chance to buy a home with such history and character and size with an irreplaceable, private established garden only two-minute drive to Bendigo's CBD.
